commText: Head and Abhishek Sharma are at the crease. Head is on strike. Rabada will open the attack

Rabada to Head, no run, that's a beauty, Jitesh goes up straightaway - Rabada wasn't sure and he only joins the appeal, they don't take the review - on a length and a hint of late shape away from the left-hander, opened up Head completely as he looked to work it onto the on-side, there was a noise, but it wasn't off the bat. Oh dear! Replays in and there's a spike on the UltraEdge when the ball was next to the bat, a clear edge, but Rabada wasn't sure
Rabada to Head, no run, short of a good length and angling across the left-hander, Head throws his hands on the cut and is undone by the angle, the ball bounces in front of Jitesh Sharma
Rabada to Head, FOUR, edged and four, full and wide from Rabada - Head saw the width and went hard on the drive, gets a thick edge that flew over the lone slip, one bounce and over the ropes

Rabada to Head, no run, Head is cut in half, this is some start from Rabada - shortens the length and gets it to nip back into the left-hander - Head plays down the wrong line and is beaten on the inside edge, didn't miss the off-stump by a lot
Rabada to Head, no run, this is a cracking start from Rabada - short of a good length and shaping across the left-hander, Head threw his bat on the cut and is beaten on the outside edge
Rabada to Head, no run, on a good length and just outside off - a half-forward stride as Head defended. A brilliant first over and he has only himself to blame for not getting a wicket
Arshdeep Singh, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off - Abhishek brings the bat down at an angle and skews an inside edge past the leg-stump
Arshdeep Singh to Head, no run, Arshdeep shortens the length outside off - Head was looking to force it off the back-foot and inner halves the drive to mid-off

Arshdeep Singh to Head, 1 run, drilled, but Dhawan gets a good hand as he dived to his left and has saved three runs for his team - fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Head stayed on the back-foot as he hammered the drive past the bowler
Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, no run, on a good length and shaping away from outside off - Abhishek covers the line, lifts his bat and lets it go

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, uppish and four, back of a length and shaping away from wide of off - Abhishek plays away from his body, an open-faced poke and he gets it wide of the diving fielder at backward point. Shashank Singh was the fielder
Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, no run, on a good length and nipping away from outside off, left alone

Rabada to Head, FOUR, streaky and four, Head is living a charmed life, fuller length delivery and shaping back into the left-hander, Head clears his front-foot on the hoick, gets a thick inside edge and the ball runs away past the diving keeper

Rabada to Head, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Head - this will give him some confidence, back of a length and well wide of off, he gets on top of the bounce and then clatters it backward of square on the off-side for a boundary

Rabada to Head, FOUR, make that three in a row, Head is making Rabada pay now - on a length and at the stumps, Head gets forward and then drives it on the rise, clears mid-on and bounces away to the ropes
Rabada to Head, no run, banged in short and angling across the left-hander, Head backs away on the cut and is beaten on the top-edge
Rabada to Head, 2 runs, Rabada keeps it full and just outside off - Head makes room, plays with an open face and then slices the drive over backward point, back for the second
Rabada to Head, 2 runs, 16 off the over, short and at the body, Head backs away and doesn't get hold of the pull, muscles it past square leg and he's back for the second

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, a direct hit and it could have been close - Abhishek pushed one straight to cover-point and called his partner through for a quick single. He would have been short had there been a direct hit
Arshdeep Singh to Head, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Arshdeep Singh to Head, out Caught by Dhawan!! A good running catch and Dhawan does the thigh-slap celebrations after holding onto the catch. On a good length and angling across the left-hander, Head went hard on the drive, lost his poise and skewed it high in the air - it went over mid-off, but so did Dhawan as he ran back, kept his eyes on the ball all the time and completes a fine running catch. Head looked very scratchy and PBKS have removed him pretty cheaply. Head c Dhawan b Arshdeep Singh 21(15) [4s-4]
Aiden Markram, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Arshdeep Singh to Markram, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Markram leans across and drives it straight to the fielder at cover
Arshdeep Singh to Markram, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Arshdeep Singh to Markram, out Caught by Jitesh Sharma!! One brings two for Arshdeep and Punjab have been on the ball tonight. On a good length and shaping across the right-hander, Markram's feet hardly moved as he shaped for the drive, gets a thin edge and Jitesh Sharma does the rest. A blob for Markram and SRH find themselves in a spot of bother. Markram c Jitesh Sharma b Arshdeep Singh 0(2)
Nitish Reddy, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Arshdeep Singh to Nitish Reddy, no run, fuller length delivery and shaping across the right-hander, left alone
Arshdeep Singh to Nitish Reddy, wide, Arshdeep pushes one short and across the right-hander, Nitish throws his bat on the cut and misses, it's past the tramlines and is called as a wide

Arshdeep Singh to Nitish Reddy, no run, nearly a third for Arshdeep - lovely bowling from the left-arm seamer, shortens the length and nops one across the right-hander, has Nitish poking and beats him on the angle
Sam Curran, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, no run, that's a corker, fuller length delivery that kept coming back and then seams away viciously - Abhishek is completely undone by the late movement as he looked to flick and missed, could've so easily edged it
Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, no run, fuller length delivery and holding its line outside off, left alone
Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, wide, Curran shortens the length and pushes one well wide of off as Abhishek came down the pitch, well past the tramlines and is called as a wide
Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, no run, on a good length and shaping away from outside off, left alone

Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, gorgeous, Curran gets greedy and looks for swing, but this is a wide half-volley and it's sent soring over cover with a superb drive, went a long way into the stands

Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Abhishek - too full and too straight from Curran, Abhishek gets inside the line and then whips it over mid-on, one bounce and over the ropes
Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Sam Curran to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by Shashank Singh!! Curran has his man and PBKS have got three inside the batting PP. Kept it short and kept it wide as Abhishek came charging down the wicket, he had to reach out on the drive and it came off the lower half - the ball was dying in front of him at cover-point, but Shashank dived forward, gets both hands under and holds onto a fine catch. Abhishek Sharma c Shashank Singh b Sam Curran 16(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Over Summary (1-5 ov) -- Head nicks behind 1st ball but Punjab don't review -- Arshdeep finds some swing -- Hat-trick of fours for Head against Rabada (16-run over) -- Arshdeep nips out Head and Markram in the same over -- Curran removes Abhishek after conceding 10 runs off the previous 2 balls
Three wickets inside the batting PP and SRH have had to make changes to their plans - Rahul Tripathi walks in as the impact sub, he replaces Travis Head
Rahul Tripathi, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Harshal Patel, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Harshal Patel to Nitish Reddy, no run, on a good length and just outside off - Nitish leans forward and defends it to mid-off
Harshal Patel to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, driven to the left of cover where Raza tumbles and makes a half-stop, keeping them down to a single
Harshal Patel to Tripathi, no run, nicely bowled, fuller length delivery and shaping away from wide of off, a laden-footed Tripathi looks to drive and is beaten on the outside edge
Sixes hit in Powerplay by SRH this IPL cycle IPL 2022: 14 sixes (14 matches) IPL 2023: 12 sixes (14 matches) IPL 2024: 15* sixes (5* matches)
Harshal Patel to Tripathi, no run, on a good length and angling back into the right-hander, defended to the off-side
Harshal Patel to Tripathi, no run, Harshal shortens the length as Tripathi came down the track, he misses and Jitesh Sharma throws down the stumps, but Tripathi has made his ground back
Jitesh hit the base of the off-stump and might've caused some damage, it'll be replaced now

Harshal Patel to Tripathi, no run, a wide has been called, but PBKS are certain that the ball flicked the pad on its way to the keeper and they've reviewed. It's clearly gone off the back-thigh, UltraEdge confirms it and the decision has been overturned, a successful review. Was full and at the pads, Tripathi was shaping to flick and missed

Impact sub stat: Sixth over is the second earliest an Impact Sub has been activated by a team in IPL. MI exercised the option in the second over in their game against RR earlier in the season at Wankhede.
Spin and it's Brar
Harpreet Brar, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, flatter and at the stumps, driven down to long-on for a single

Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, no run, Tripathi tries to be too cheeky and nearly pays the price - runs across the stumps and then tried to paddle it fine, but Harpreet follows him and tucks him for space, might've flicked the pad on its way to the keeper
SRH - 40/3 in Powerplay \n- their lowest total in Powerplay this IPL \n- the first time they have lost more than one wicket in this phase this season
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, no run, pushed through by Harpreet - Tripathi goes back and squirts it to the off-side
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, FOUR, nicely played, dropped short and wide of off, Tripathi backs away, opens up the off-side and then places the cut square past point
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, leg byes, 1 run, tossed up on the leg-stump line, Tripathi was looking to flick and missed, off the pad and rolled to the on-side for a leg-bye
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, Harpreet tosses one on middle, worked off the back-foot past mid-wicket for a single
Curran, from round the wicket
Sam Curran [1.0-0-11-1] is back into the attack

Sam Curran to Nitish Reddy, FOUR, lovely, back of a length and just outside off - Nitish is quick to spot the length, stays on the front-foot as he swivelled onto the pull, over mid-wicket and bounces away to the ropes
Sam Curran to Nitish Reddy, no run, short and wide of off, cut powerfully and to the left of backward point where Brar makes a tumbling save, lpreventing the boundary
Sam Curran to Nitish Reddy, no run, on a good length and just outside off, pushed to the off-side
Sam Curran to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, tad short and just outside off, punched into the gap square past cover for a single

Sam Curran to Tripathi, 2 runs, back of a length and well wide of off, Tripathi comes down the wicket, makes room and slices the cut over cover-point, takes on the fielder and hurries back for the second
Sam Curran to Tripathi, 2 runs, on a good length and just outside off - Tripathi leans across, uses the pace on the ball, an open-faced drive and gets it square past point, comes back for the second
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, tossed up on middle and off, eased down to long-on for a single
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle, Tripathi gets down low and swipes it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, dragged short and on off, pulled down to long-on for a single
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, 1 run, Tripathi comes down the wicket and then drives one down to long-on for a single
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, no run, pushed through outside off - Nitish went hard on the flat-footed cut, but he can't beat cover
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, worked off the back-foot past square leg, he wanted a second and is sent back in time

Time for the strategic break. PBKS have read this pitch perfectly, they started with Rabada, should've had a wicket first-ball, but they didn't let that missed chance go in waste - Arshdeep striking twice in his 2nd over and Sum Curran chipping in with one. That forced SRH into using their impact sub - they still have Klaasen in the shed, but they'll need to make 15-20 more runs to account for one less bowling option later tonight
Harshal Patel [1.0-0-1-0] is back into the attack
Harshal Patel to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, on a good length and on off, dropped in front of backward point for a single
Harshal Patel to Tripathi, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, was the attempted slower ball, Tripathi reaches out and steers it square past point
Harshal Patel to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, on a length and just outside off, driven square on the off-side for a single
Dhawan has reviewed
Harshal Patel to Tripathi, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Harshal Patel to Tripathi, out Caught by Jitesh Sharma!! An appeal for caught behind, Jitesh Sharma wasn't so sure this time, but the bowler was confident, so was Sam Curran, he must have heard something because Dhawan has reviewed. Was a slower short ball and Tripathi was looking to ramp it over the keeper's head, the ball has caught the toe-end though and PBKS have another successful review - Tripathi is OUT. A wicket out of nowhere, an innocuous slower bouncer and the right-hander only managed to toe-end it on its way to the keeper. Tripathi c Jitesh Sharma b Harshal Patel 11(14) [4s-1]
Heinrich Klaasen, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Harshal Patel to Klaasen, 1 run, on a length and just outside off, steered behind square on the off-side for a single
Harshal Patel to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, nudged with an open face, behind square on the off-side for a single

Over Summary (6-10 ov) - 27/1 -- Tripathi comes in as Impact Player -- Harshal bowls a tidy over -- Tripathi takes 7 balls to get off the mark -- Successful review from PBKS; Tripathi falls to Harshal's slower ball bouncer -- Just two boundaries in this phase
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, no run, flighted delivery on off, Nitish backs away and chops the cut to backward point
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, FOUR, cracking shot, dropped short and wide of off - Nitish backs away, plays late and then cuts it square behind point, beating the fielder in the deep

Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, SIX, back-to-back boundaries for Nitish - a real drag-down by Brar, was looking to pull the length back, Nitish rocks back and then muscles the pull, high and deep into the stands at backward square leg
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, flighted delivery on off, Nitish plays late and into the gap wide of cover for a single
Harpreet Brar to Klaasen, no run, tossed up just outside off - Klaasen stays back and went hard on the drive, mistiming it to cover

Harpreet Brar to Klaasen, FOUR, a big effort from Curran, but the ball was always wide of him - was tossed up and Klaasen backed away on the lofgted drive, didn't get hold of the shot, muscled it high and back past the bowler - was skimming through though, Curran ran to his left at long-on, put in the one-handed dive, but can't get to the ball, one bounce and over the ropes
Kagiso Rabada [2.0-0-20-0] is back into the attack
Rabada to Nitish Reddy, no run, short of a length and at the pads, turned to the on-side
Rabada to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Nitish runs it down towards third man
Rabada to Klaasen, no run, short of a length and into the body, Klaasen is tucked for room as he drops it down at his feet
Rabada to Klaasen, 1 run, short and into the body, Klaasen awkwardly nudges it in front of mid-wicket for a single
Rabada to Nitish Reddy, SIX, magnificent, short and at the stumps, Nitish picks the length early, gets inside the line, uses Rabada's pace and then helps it over long leg with the pull
Rabada to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, got big on Nitish who manages to drop it wide of the keeper for a single
Sam Curran [2.0-0-20-1] is back into the attack

Sam Curran to Nitish Reddy, SIX, Nitish is dealing in sixes at the moment - slower short ball from Curran, but he's picked it early, swivels across and then thumps the pull into the stands at deep backward square leg
Sam Curran to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, driven past cover for a single
Sam Curran to Klaasen, no run, the cutter from Curran, Klaasen is cramped for space as he punches it to cover
Sam Curran to Klaasen, 2 runs, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, driven into the gap wide of cover and Klaasen scurries back for the second
Sam Curran to Klaasen, 1 run, short of a good length and well wide of off, clattered to deep cover for a single
Sam Curran to Nitish Reddy, no run, Curran keeps it full and wide of off, Nitish went too hard on the slash, lost his balance and is beaten on the angle
Harshal Patel [2.0-0-6-1] is back into the attack
Harshal Patel to Klaasen, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Harshal Patel to Klaasen, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Klaasen turned around and started to walk as soon as he hit that. Curran takes the catch, turns towards the crowd and does a double fist pump. This is a massive wicket for Punjab Kings. Even Harshal is delighted. This was a I0$ good length delivery and Klaasen looks to loft through the line, gets it high on the bat and miscues it to long-off, Curran makes no mistake. Klaasen c Sam Curran b Harshal Patel 9(9) [4s-1]
Abdul Samad, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, 1 run, full delivery on leg, Samad flicks to fine leg and gets off the mark
Harshal Patel to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Reddy angles it to backward point
Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, FOUR, full pitcher with width on offer, Samad throws his bat and slices it over backward point. Not quite where he wanted but SRH will take them any which way

Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, FOUR, back to back boundaries. This is angled in and ends up nicely on the pads, Samad leans forward and clips it wide of mid-wicket. All timing as the ball runs away.. Dhawan goes across to have a word with Harshal
Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, wide, slower bouncer and Samad barely had to duck, called wide for height
Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, no run, back of a length on off, Samad knocks it back to Harshal
Harpreet Brar [3.0-0-26-0] is back into the attack
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, no run, I0$ full delivery around off, Reddy drills it back to Brar and he makes a half stop
Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, FOUR, wow! This is some shot from Reddy. This was darted at the stumps, Reddy reverses his stance, crouches low and swipes it over backward point

Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, SIX, that's very unlike Brar. He gifts a juicy full toss and Reddy does not miss out, he smokes it into the cow corner stand for a 91-meter six. Brings up his maiden IPL fifty. This has been a superb innings and one that has kept SRH in the game. He raises his bat and soaks in the applause of his team mates

Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, FOUR, dropped! This is not quite short but Reddy goes for the pull, miscues it towards deep mid-wicket and Shashank moves to his left, gets both hands and parries it into the rope. He never looked settled and was on the move as he attempted to catch that. How costly will this prove?

Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, SIX, smashed! Reddy is turning it on for SRH. Brar has turned to his darts and is being carted around. Fired full and right in the slot, Reddy extends his arms and launches it over long-off

Harpreet Brar to Nitish Reddy, 2 runs, flatter and the length is shortened, Reddy chops it in front of square and races back for the second. Brar finishes with 4-0-48-0 - his most expensive figures in IPL

Over Summary (11-15 ov) - 67/1 -- 15 runs off Brar's 2nd over -- Nitish Reddy hits 3 sixes in 3 overs -- Harshal gets the big wicket of Klaasen who holes out to long-of -- Abdul Samad gets going with back-to-back fours -- Maiden IPL fifty for Nitish, reaches the milestone with a six -- Shashank drops Nitish on 51 -- Expensive outing for Brar - 4-0-48-0

Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, 1 run, in the air and safe. Dhawan runs back but cannot get there. Very similar to the way Klaasen got out. Samad looks to loft through the line and mistimes it towards mid-off, Dhawan runs back from extra cover and puts the dive, but the ball is out of his reach
Harshal Patel to Nitish Reddy, 1 run, angled in on off and middle, Reddy knocks it with soft hands in front of long-on
Harshal Patel in IPL 2024 \nOvers 1-15: 5/80 in 11 overs (ER 7.27) \nOvers 16-20: 1/118 in 8 overs (ER 14.75)
Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, 2 runs, short of length and slanted into the pads, Samad flicks in front of square and picks up a brace

Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, FOUR, slower ball bowled into the wicket, Samad had the width and he slaps it in front of square on the off-side, Shashank gets around from sweeper and cannot get there in time

Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, FOUR, Harshal has lost the plot against Samad. That's the fourth boundary Samad has scored off Harshal. Drifted down leg, Samad helps it along the way with a neat little clip
Harshal Patel to Abdul Samad, 1 run, back of a length off-pace delivery, Samad flat-bats it straight to long-off. Harshal ends with figures of 4-0-30-2

Timeout! This pair have changed the complexion of the game in less than 3 overs. Samad came in and struck a couple of boundaries, while Reddy took Brar apart. The run-rate is over 9rpo now and they are on course to that 180+ total. Harshal has bowled out, Rabada has one and Curran one, all responsibility on Arshdeep to finish properly as he has two overs.
Arshdeep Singh [2.0-0-8-2] is back into the attack
Arshdeep Singh to Abdul Samad, FOUR, just wide of Jitesh Sharma. Wide yorker outside off, Samad bends down, opens the bat face and slices it to the right of Jitesh. No chance to take the catch

SRH review! It is for a wide call. Samad wasn't sure but Reddy has coaxed him to send it upstairs. Samad is standing just outside off-stump. The ball is outside the marker but since Samad was standing outside off, it will be a fair delivery.

Arshdeep Singh to Abdul Samad, no run, SRH lose a review. Very full delivery outside off, Samad throws his bat and does not connect with the drive. The ball was outside the wide guideline but Samad was standing outside off-stump, so no wide
Arshdeep Singh to Abdul Samad, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Arshdeep Singh to Abdul Samad, out Caught by Harshal Patel!! It is Arshdeep's night. Third wicket for him and more importantly he breaks the partnership. Samad struck it well but picked out the fielder. Full delivery outside off, Samad slices the loft and hits it straight to deep backward point, Harshal came in a few steps to take the catch. Punjab needed that.. Abdul Samad c Harshal Patel b Arshdeep Singh 25(12) [4s-5]
Shahbaz Ahmed, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Arshdeep Singh to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, back of a length on middle, Shahbaz flicks through the vacant mid-wicket region
Arshdeep Singh to Nitish Reddy, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Arshdeep Singh to Nitish Reddy, out Caught by Rabada!! Arshdeep has turned the game on its head. Second wicket in the over and this is the big one of a well-set Reddy. Not a wicket-taking delivery and Reddy would be kicking himself. Full toss at a hittable height and Reddy throws his bat on the big shot, miscues it high and Rabada accepts the catch near long-off. Dhawan has a big smile on his face and the Punjab flags are waving across Mullanpur. Nitish Reddy c Rabada b Arshdeep Singh 64(37) [4s-4 6s-5]
Pat Cummins, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Arshdeep Singh to Cummins, 1 run, very full and outside off, Cummins opens the bat face and drives to sweeper cover
Kagiso Rabada [3.0-0-29-0] is back into the attack
Rabada to Cummins, no run, back of a length around off, Cummins guides it to backward point and there's no chance of a single

Rabada to Cummins, 2 runs, in the air and safe. Short and bowled into the body, Cummins miscues the pull and the ball skies up, lands just outside the mid-wicket circle and the batters scamper back for the second
Rabada to Cummins, wide, I0$ slower bouncer and Cummins sways out of the line, wide called for height
Rabada to Cummins, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Rabada to Cummins, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Finally Rabada has his name in the wickets column. He's bowled well today without anything to show, now he cleans up the SRH skipper. Good length delivery and Cummins swings across the line, misses and the ball hits the top of middle-stump. SRH have lost their way completely in the last couple of overs. Will they be bowled out? Cummins b Rabada 3(4)
Bhuvneshwar Kumar, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Rabada to Bhuvneshwar, no run, I0$ back of a length in the channel, Bhuvneshwar has a tentative poke and is beaten on the outside edge
Rabada to Bhuvneshwar, no run, he's still bowling jaffas. This was back of a length on middle, Bhuvneshwar is squared up as the ball straightens late and beats him comprehensively
Rabada to Bhuvneshwar, leg byes, 1 run, angled in and Bhuvneshwar misses the flick, the ball hits the thigh pad and rolls back
Arshdeep Singh to Bhuvneshwar, 2 runs, full and outside off, Bhuvneshwar drives in front of square and Rabada gets around from long-off, keeps it to a brace
Arshdeep Singh to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, very full and outside off, Bhuvneshwar squeezes it to deep backward point
Arshdeep Singh to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run, full toss and Shahbaz hits the drive straight to Dhawan at extra cover
Arshdeep Singh to Shahbaz Ahmed, FOUR, much needed. Slower ball outside off, Shahbaz waits and slices the drive to the left of backward point
Arshdeep Singh to Shahbaz Ahmed, wide, slower bouncer and Shahbaz does not even duck, too high and hence called wide
Arshdeep Singh to Shahbaz Ahmed, SIX, wow! That is as good as Abhishek's shot against Curran. Full and outside off, Shahbaz flows through the loft and sends it sailing over deep extra cover
Arshdeep Singh to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, smart batting. Shahbaz drops it with soft hands into the off-side and retains strike for the last over. Arshdeep finishes an impressive spell - 4-0-29-4
Sam Curran [3.0-0-30-1] is back into the attack
Sam Curran to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Shahbaz drills it towards long-off and has to settle with a single
Sam Curran to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, short of length delivery, Bhuvneshwar pulls to deep mid-wicket and hands the strike back to Shahbaz
Sam Curran to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, spears it into the blockhole, Shahbaz digs it towards extra cover
Sam Curran to Bhuvneshwar, 2 runs, slower ball on leg, Bhuvneshwar swipes it wide of deep mid-wicket and calls for two, gets it with ease
Sam Curran to Bhuvneshwar, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Sam Curran to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught by Bairstow!! Bhuvneshwar perishes for the team's cause. Full pitcher and it was in the slot, but Bhuvneshwar does not get hold of the loft and mistimes it to long-off, Bairstow runs in and takes a good catch. Bhuvneshwar c Bairstow b Sam Curran 6(8)
Jaydev Unadkat, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Sam Curran to Unadkat, SIX, palmed over. Curran cannot believe it. Harshal the culprit. SRH cross the 180-mark. Unadkat and Shahbaz punch gloves and run away with a smile on their faces. Short of length delivery and Unadkat flat-bats it to long-on, Harshal moves to his left and goes with his hands above his head,

21:16 Local Time, 15:46 GMT: Sunrisers Hyderabad would have mixed feelings about this total. They got off to a horrid start - losing three wickets inside the powerplay for the first time, but recovered thanks to a superb knock from Nitish Reddy. He started slowly but picked up the pace as the innings progressed, added a 50+ stand with Samad and the pair looked to have given SRH the platform to reach close to 200, but a slew of wickets after the 16th over timeout derailed proceedings. Shahbaz struck a couple of boundaries in the 19th and the last ball six from Unadkat took them past 180. Arshdeep was the pick of the bowlers as he finished with a 4-fer, he picked two wickets apiece in his second and third over, Harshal backed him well and so did Rabada. This is a par total on this surface and if SRH's new ball bowlers can get the same help as Punjab Kings then we would have an exciting chase on our hands. Back soon..
Nitish Reddy - innings of two halves \nFirst 18 balls: 14 runs (1 X 4s, SR 77.77) \nLast 19 balls: 50 runs (3 X 4s, 5 X 6s, SR 263.15)
Pace vs spin in SRH innings \nPace: 9/132 off 16 overs (ER 8.25) \nSpin: 0/48 off 4 overs (ER 12.00)
First time in IPL 2024, PBKS have conceded fewer than 50 runs in the death overs (16-20)

Arshdeep Singh: To start with, there was some movement in the wicket and it was a little sticky. Afterwards, a little dew came in and the wicket settled. I was very happy till the third over but it was a really good day. Just trying to stick to my plans and deliver to the team. (Bowling in the last 5 overs) It's because of the ground dimensions, hitting boundaries straighter is relatively easier than hitting it square. We wanted to take advantage of the bigger square boundary. Even in the first game that we played here, we used a lot of slower bouncers and this game wanted to bowl wide yorkers.

Welcome back.. Dhawan and Baistow are walking out to the middle. Bhuvneshwar has the new ball in his hand. The first six overs are going to be crucial for both teams. There's one slip in place. We are ready to go
